While the technical name for this ship is "Hauler I: Type F," Southbound assembly workers started calling the single container variant the "Nest" due to its complement of Finch Fighters, and the name stuck.

name: Osprey (Osprey (Alien Weapons))
description: After the Blackbird gained surprising popularity as an agile light warship despite its original design as a transport, Tarazed decided to produce a new design specifically intended as a warship. The Osprey was the result. Although it is considered overpriced by most savvy pilots, it is nevertheless a perennial favorite among those who have the extra cash to spend on it.

name: Osprey (Osprey (Laser))
description: After the Blackbird gained surprising popularity as an agile light warship despite its original design as a transport, Tarazed decided to produce a new design specifically intended as a warship. name: Protector (Protector (Laser))
description: Voted the "ugliest ship in the sky" by Stars and Starships Magazine, the Protector is a typical example of brutally efficient Syndicate engineering. It is basically nothing more than eight turrets attached to a set of engines and crew's quarters, designed as a defense platform that can accompany merchant convoys.

description: Voted the "ugliest ship in the sky" by Stars and Starships Magazine, the Protector is a typical example of brutally efficient Syndicate engineering. It is basically nothing more than eight turrets attached to a set of engines and crew's quarters, designed as a defense platform that can accompany merchant convoys.

name: Quicksilver (Quicksilver (Mark II))
description: The Megaparsec Quicksilver is a warship built around a single concept: to design the smallest and fastest ship capable of carrying two Particle Cannons. Because of its speed, reverse thrusters, and long weapons range, the Quicksilver can keep a safe distance from most targets and bombard them with particle bursts until they are destroyed. The focus on its weaponry left the Quicksilver with no room for even the most basic shield generator. Unfortunately the Headhunter eventually surpassed the original design intent, but the Quicksilver's better durability to cost ratio, and the existence of long-term contracts, has kept it in use with Syndicate security forces.

name: Quicksilver (Quicksilver (Proton))
description: The Megaparsec Quicksilver is a warship built around a single concept: to design the smallest and fastest ship capable of carrying two Particle Cannons. Because of its speed, reverse thrusters, and long weapons range, the Quicksilver can keep a safe distance from most targets and bombard them with particle bursts until they are destroyed. The focus on its weaponry left the Quicksilver with no room for even the most basic shield generator. name: Rainmaker (Rainmaker (Mark II))
description: The Rainmaker is a missile boat built in the Republic Navy Yard. It comes equipped with four missile launchers and enough ammunition to destroy even ships many times its size. Because of their lack of maneuverability and relatively light shielding, Rainmakers serve best as long-range attack ships, and once their missile supply is spent, they are relatively useless in combat.

name: Raven (Raven (Afterburner))
description: The Lionheart Raven is their most popular warship, an agile and elegant vessel that can nevertheless deal out and absorb considerable damage. Ravens are a favorite ship for bounty hunters, because they are more than a match for pirate interceptors and can be used by a skilled pilot to take down much larger ships as well.

name: Raven (Raven (Heavy))
description: The Lionheart Raven is their most popular warship, an agile and elegant vessel that can nevertheless deal out and absorb considerable damage. Ravens are a favorite ship for bounty hunters, because they are more than a match for pirate interceptors and can be used by a skilled pilot to take down much larger ships as well.

name: Roost (Roost (Sidewinder))
description: Southbound Shipyards' new fighter-carrying containers have created a new use for what many considered an outdated design. Four external fighter bays make this the biggest civilian carrier on the market, if a little awkward as a warship. After Southbound assembly workers successfully named the "Nest," "Hauler II: Type F" was quickly dubbed the "Roost" to continue the theme.

name: Saber (Saber (CCOR Gatling))
description: During the caravan era, a boom of economic development spread along the paths of more heavily armed and technologically advanced merchant fleets originating from the Deep, which resulted in ships such as the Saber being developed. This medium warship was one of the powerhouses of military might in its time, armed to the teeth with five gun ports in the nose and a dorsal turret mount to fire at anything not in front of it. As pirates began to join together in larger war bands in response to the more heavily defended merchants, the Saber became popular amongst them as well. Unlike other ships such as the Firebird, it slowly faded out as competition rose, but it is nevertheless cherished by those who still own one.

name: Saber (Saber (CCOR Javelin))
description: During the caravan era, a boom of economic development spread along the paths of more heavily armed and technologically advanced merchant fleets originating from the Deep, which resulted in ships such as the Saber being developed. This medium warship was one of the powerhouses of military might in its time, armed to the teeth with five gun ports in the nose and a dorsal turret mount to fire at anything not in front of it. Unlike other ships such as the Firebird, it slowly faded out as competition rose, but it is nevertheless cherished by those who still own one.

name: Scout (Scout (Speedy))
description: The Lionheart Scoutship was designed back in the days when the galaxy was more sparsely populated, and ships prospecting for habitable worlds or worlds rich in resources would often travel far away from any habitable ports where they would be able to refuel. Although the galaxy has now been much more thoroughly explored, the Scout remains a popular ship for long-distance travel.

name: Scrapper (Scrapper (Gatling))
description: Rather than being a specific model of ship, the Scrappers are instead a family of vessels cobbled together from the remains of broken shuttles. On the rare occasion that Republic authorities bother to recognize their existence, Scrappers are treated as almost-illegal, patent-infringing death traps. Despite this, these ships are where many captains (and pirates) from poorer backgrounds get their start.

name: Scrapper (Scrapper (Minimal))
description: Rather than being a specific model of ship, the Scrappers are instead a family of vessels cobbled together from the remains of broken shuttles. Despite this, these ships are where many captains (and pirates) from poorer backgrounds get their start.

Despite this, these ships are where many captains (and pirates) from poorer backgrounds get their start.

name: Skein (Skein (Sidewinder))
description: This particular cockpit and engine set has found itself attached to three of Southbound Shipyards' new "Type F" Fighter-carrier pods. When the Free Worlds asked for a carrier, they did not expect one that would be able to carry almost as many fighters as the heaviest Navy warships. Given this fact, the Free Worlds have asked Southbound and Tarazed to restrict sale of the "Hauler III: Type F," "Skein" to its Militia only.

name: Sparrow (Sparrow (Gatling))
description: Classified as an interceptor rather than a fighter because it has its own hyperdrive instead of needing to be carried inside a larger ship, the Tarazed Sparrow is the smallest and cheapest combat ship available. Because of its limited cargo and passenger space, the primary way for a Sparrow pilot to pay the bills is to upgrade the weapons and hunt pirates... or become one. In either case, it is a perilous way to earn a living. 	Government reports indicate that as many as two out of every three first-time ship buyers who choose to pilot a Sparrow lose their ship (and often, their life as well) within the first month of owning it. Pilots who have survived longer than that tend to swear by replacing the stock weapons with missile launchers.

name: Splinter (Splinter (Laser))
description: The Splinter is the largest warship produced by the Megaparsec shipyard. It is designed to be faster and more maneuverable than other ships of a similar size, in order to serve as a heavy escort ship or as part of a planetary defense and patrol fleet. Because of its intended use in merchant convoys, it also has a fair amount of cargo space.

name: Splinter (Splinter (Mark II))
description: The Splinter is the largest warship produced by the Megaparsec shipyard. name: Star Barge (Star Barge (Armed))
description: The Syndicate CT-50 Star Barge is little more than a cluster of cargo containers with an engine at one end and a cockpit on the other. It is a slow and ugly ship, but it can carry enough cargo to earn its captain a steady income even in parts of the galaxy where it is hard to find passengers to carry or courier missions. 	Because they often carry valuable cargo, and because they are too slow to evade any attackers, Star Barges are a common target of pirates.

name: Star Queen (Star Queen (Hai))
description: The Star Queen is a relic of a more peaceful period of galactic history: a luxury liner for high-end tourists. Every cabin has its own mini-bar, and the bathrooms have marble tile and showers that use actual hot water instead of chemicals or sonic vibrations. 	In support of environmental movements across the galaxy, all Star Queens come standard with an array of solar panels as their only source of energy as opposed to more popular power generators such as fuel cells or nuclear reactors that produce some amount of waste. Although some argue that this is a pointless move given the prevalence of clean fusion reactors, others have applauded it and cited the prohibitive costs of fusion reactors as a reason for using solar panels.

name: Star Queen (Star Queen (Hai Trafficker))
description: The Star Queen is a relic of a more peaceful period of galactic history: a luxury liner for high-end tourists. Although some argue that this is a pointless move given the prevalence of clean fusion reactors, others have applauded it and cited the prohibitive costs of fusion reactors as a reason for using solar panels.

name: Vanguard (Vanguard (Missile))
description: The Vanguard is Syndicated Systems' newest warship intended for the heavy anti-pirate defense market. Vanguards offer an unusual feature set, focusing on powerful fixed guns and featuring Syndicated Systems' latest automation technologies, resulting in an atypically low crew complement for a ship its size. Few capital ships will endure for long under the withering fusillade of gunfire that it can unleash against those in front of it.

name: Vanguard (Vanguard (Particle))
description: The Vanguard is Syndicated Systems' newest warship intended for the heavy anti-pirate defense market. Vanguards offer an unusual feature set, focusing on powerful fixed guns and featuring Syndicated Systems' latest automation technologies, resulting in an atypically low crew complement for a ship its size. Few capital ships will endure for long under the withering fusillade of gunfire that it can unleash against those in front of it.

name: Wasp (Wasp (Gatling))
description: The Wasp is a medium-strength interceptor, designed by Syndicated Shipyards to serve as an escort for cargo vessels. Like most Syndicate ships, it is not particularly pretty, but it at least serves the purpose it was made for.

name: Wasp (Wasp (Javelin))
description: The Wasp is a medium-strength interceptor, designed by Syndicated Shipyards to serve as an escort for cargo vessels. Like most Syndicate ships, it is not particularly pretty, but it at least serves the purpose it was made for.

description: The Wasp is a medium-strength interceptor, designed by Syndicated Shipyards to serve as an escort for cargo vessels. Like most Syndicate ships, it is not particularly pretty, but it at least serves the purpose it was made for.

description: The Wasp is a medium-strength interceptor, designed by Syndicated Shipyards to serve as an escort for cargo vessels. Like most Syndicate ships, it is not particularly pretty, but it at least serves the purpose it was made for.

name: Nimbus (Nimbus FTL)
description: The Nimbus is the first spaceship that the Incipias built that was truly able to navigate through a system. Since it was first manufactured it has been cherished among wealthier captains and a dream of captains just starting out. 	Although the Nimbus is labeled as a medium warship, it is multipurpose; whether one uses it for mining, passenger transport or cargo, it will perform its job nicely. It is only occasionally used in combat because the Incipias are not currently fighting open wars.

name: Nimbus (Nimbus (Civilian))
description: The Nimbus is the first spaceship that the Incipias built that was truly able to navigate through a system. Since it was first manufactured it has been cherished among wealthier captains and a dream of captains just starting out. 	Although the Nimbus is labeled as a medium warship, it is multipurpose; whether one uses it for mining, passenger transport or cargo, it will perform its job nicely. It is only occasionally used in combat because the Incipias are not currently fighting open wars.

name: Fetri'sei (Fetri'sei (Patir 12.2))
description: The Fetri is a self replicating probe, built to harvest iridium away from the Graveyard and transport it back to the Builders.

name: Faes'mar (Faes'mar (Strong))
description: The Mar were the last and most successful ships of the Builders in their attempts at creating automatic drones. Today only the Het stations are still aware of their blueprints, and keep producing the Faes'mar to transport the resources mined to the station's cargo bay. 	Drones do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a drone unless you have a ship in your fleet with a drone bay.

name: Charm-Shallop (Charm-Shallop (Distressed))
description: A recent design, this Efreti multi-role vessel is found taking up many jobs previously relegated to a now scrapped fleet of early-model raiders. While some are used primarily for passenger transport, others are used in local mining to satiate the Efreti's perpetual demand for ores. Incorporating Quarg-inspired structural elements, its light frame allows it to complete tasks more nimbly than any other independent Korath ship.

name: Rano'erek (Rano'erek (Civilian))
description: After the Korath were exiled from their homelands, efficient resource collection became a priority. World-ships were too precious to risk on dangerous forays, and raiders lacked the cargo capacity. The Rano'erek-class Asteroid Dredging Ship, named for a respected civilian politician and economist, was born as an answer to this problem. 	Featuring an abundance of cargo and passenger space in addition to their formidable defensive armament, these bulky ships can also offer potent support for frontline Palavrets.

name: Palavret (Palavret (Blaze))
description: Successive raider designs have been the Korath warship of choice for plundering neighboring species for generations. Named for a celebrated captain who gave her life to ensure her crippled vessel made it back to port with its desperately needed cargo of stolen fish, the Palavret-Class Raiding Ship continues that grim tradition. 	Like all Exile ships, the Palavret has been adapted to house as many Korath as possible, as comfortably as possible, inflating its size beyond similarly armed warships. The spaceborne construction techniques employed allow for the ship's easy replacement, facilitating continued raids of nearby systems.

name: Tubfalet (Tubfalet (Crippler))
description: The venerable Palavret has been a mainstay of the Korath raiding fleet, elements of its design dating back from before the era of shortages and desperation caused by a life in exile. Over forty generations of raiders have terrorized neighboring systems over the centuries. 	Constant warfare against surrounding aliens has been building pressure on Korath shipyards to recover some of their ancient prowess. Now, with a fresh industrial network to draw upon, the Korath have created a new raider to deal with modern targets, and the Tubfalet-Class Raiding Ship is named for an admiral who dealt with such enemies. Despite extensive injuries, he remained on his flag bridge during a Remnant attack, leading his squadron to victory.

name: 'nra'ret ('nra'ret (Crippler))
description: While perhaps, at first, seeming like a super-sized 'olofez-Class Carried Chaser, the 'nra'ret-Class Chaser is not only the first truly unique warship design the Exiles have fielded since the Exodus, but also the first built solely for combat instead of needing to double as a habitat or supply ship. Its size and non-modular nature also means it must be constructed wholesale at the largest Korath facilities, something that, until recently, was generally reserved for the likes of the massive Ik'atilajej and the Korsmanath A'awoj. 	The 'nra'ret-Class Chaser, named in honor of a brilliant weapons engineer who took their own life to avoid having their secrets captured by a hostile alien force, provides the Exiles with a fast and powerful patrol striker both in support of large raiding fleets and as independent units. To this end, it is armed with numerous missile ports designed to rain fire on enemies from afar. It also carries a pair of langrage heavers for sustained operations, and two Fire-Lances for emergency use in close quarters.

name: 'olofez ('olofez (Digger))
description: The 'olofez-Class Carried Chaser, named for a renowned artist who painted their visions of ancient hunts, is a fighter carried by most Exile capital ships. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

name: 'olofez ('olofez (World-Ship))
description: The 'olofez-Class Carried Chaser, named for a renowned artist who painted their visions of ancient hunts, is a fighter carried by most Exile capital ships. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

name: Lor'kas Ik 577 (Lor'kas Ik 577 (Jump))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. The simplest are adapted to haul materials between refinery and factory stations. Fittingly, they're named after a productive colony of the Efreti, to honor their focus on peaceful industry.

name: Lor'kas Ik 577 (Lor'kas Ik 577 (Digger))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. The simplest are adapted to haul materials between refinery and factory stations. Fittingly, they're named after a productive colony of the Efreti, to honor their focus on peaceful industry.

name: Ra'gru Ik 618 (Ra'gru Ik 618 (Crippled))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This deceptively spindly ship bristles with weapon emplacements for heavy raiding or defending other vessels. It is named after the Mereti's capital planet, where they made powerful warships out of modular components.

name: Kas'lor Ik 582 (Kas'lor Ik 582 (Jump))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This relatively streamlined ship has been adapted to collect, refine, and transport hyperspace fuel. Its name refers to the delicious squids that lived in their gas giants, and especially Deka Dathnak.

name: Kas'lor Ik 582 (Kas'lor Ik 582 (Stranded))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This relatively streamlined ship has been adapted to collect, refine, and transport hyperspace fuel. Its name refers to the delicious squids that lived in their gas giants, and especially Deka Dathnak.

description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. Its name refers to the delicious squids that lived in their gas giants, and especially Deka Dathnak.

name: Lor'nag Ik 590 (Lor'nag Ik 590 (Grab))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This bulbous ship has been adapted to carry passengers between stations, or boarding parties into enemy strongholds. Its name is in memory of the Anatruskor, who invented the jump drive.

name: Lor'nag Ik 590 (Lor'nag Ik 590 (Troop Transport))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This bulbous ship has been adapted to carry passengers between stations, or boarding parties into enemy strongholds. Its name is in memory of the Anatruskor, who invented the jump drive.

name: Ra'at Ik 621 (Ra'at Ik 621 (Digger))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This many-lobed ship has been adapted to carry fighters into large-scale raids, or mining craft into asteroid belts. Its radial arrangements of hangars allows fighters a maximum variety of safe approach patterns in combat. Sestor exiles, who had a great affinity for carriers and fighters, bequeathed this variant its name after their capital world.

name: Ra'at Ik 621 (Ra'at Ik 621 (Storm))
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. name: Kar Ik Vot 349 (Kar Ik Vot 349 (Offense))
description: The largest and deadliest of the Kor Sestor robotic warships, a single one of these battlecruisers can hold its own against an entire fleet of lesser ships.

name: Kar Ik Vot 349 (Kar Ik Vot 349 (Defense))
description: The largest and deadliest of the Kor Sestor robotic warships, a single one of these battlecruisers can hold its own against an entire fleet of lesser ships.

name: Kar Ik Vot 349 (Kar Ik Vot 349 (Trapper))
description: The largest and deadliest of the Kor Sestor robotic warships, a single one of these battlecruisers can hold its own against an entire fleet of lesser ships.

name: Tek Far 71 - Lek (Tek Far 71 - Lek (Close Quarters))
description: The Kor Sestor war fleets rely heavily on small, powerful fighters and drones. This ship can carry up to ten of their drones, clamped to the exterior of its hull.

name: Tek Far 78 - Osk (Tek Far 78 - Osk (Close Quarters))
description: This carrier is equipped with docking clamps for up to nine fighters. When loaded with a full complement of the powerful Kor Sestor robotic fighters, it is a formidable opponent.

name: Met Par Tek 53 (Met Par Tek 53 (Sniper))
description: Although this is the smallest Kor Sestor ship other than their fighters, it is larger than most human capital ships and considerably more powerful.

name: Starling (Starling (Keystone))
description: One of the strangest and most useful things that the Remnant have discovered in the abandoned worlds of the Ember Waste is alien cloaking technology. They have designed their scout ships to cloak when needed in order to explore alien territory without being seen... or to escape in a hurry after stealing something particularly valuable from those aliens. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Starling's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Albatross (Albatross (Sniper))
description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. Using new composite materials that they discovered, they built ships very different from anything seen in human space.

description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. Using new composite materials that they discovered, they built ships very different from anything seen in human space.

name: Albatross (Albatross (Sniper II))
description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. Using new composite materials that they discovered, they built ships very different from anything seen in human space.

name: Modified Dromedary (Modified Dromedary Ghost)
description: The Tycho Crater Cooperative's Dromedary was one of the foremost colonization ships during the early era before piracy became rampant and triggered the necessity for city-ships to be more combat-oriented. These ships incorporate extensive hydroponics, large construction equipment installations, and hundreds of densely packed "dream cells" built to transport people in bulk. 	Since the Remnant do not have schematics for the Dromedary, just the highly-modified example of the Shattered Light, this ship is actually a commemorative replica of that specific ship. As such, it combines the original's odd mix of eclectic modifications with new Remnant systems. 	Unfortunately, since they lack the manufacturing facilities that would normally support a large construction project, it will cost massively more than it would have originally back on Luna.

name: Gull (Gull (Sniper))
description: While the Starling was the first successful ship to use technology derived from alien ruins, the Gull is the most recent. The current increase in Korath activities has caused foraging for resources to become a risky endeavor, forcing the Remnant to develop a specialized freighter for hauling cargo from remote sites without revealing their presence to hostile aliens. 	The Gull has quickly proven its worth, allowing the Starling fleets to return to riskier activities while the Gull takes over the hazardous convoy routes. It is now the primary element of the Remnant's extra-territorial resource operations. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Gull's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Merganser (Merganser (II))
description: The Merganser is the first production ship the Remnant deem to be truly alive, and are considered to be equivalent to dolphins in reasoning tests. These interceptors, deemed for short range operations by Remnant standards, are designed to patrol the upper atmosphere of gas giants and use their decisive speed advantage to conduct hit-and-run attacks on threats in nearby systems. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Merganser's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Pelican (Pelican (Heavy Lift))
description: The Pelican is closely based on the original semi-organic materials the Remnant found in the Ember Waste. While they are not technically alive, their internal mechanisms and method of construction bear such a close resemblance to living organisms that they are often considered as such. One key feature of this living resemblance is the innate sensory capabilities they possess, akin to sensor suites less advanced ships require for detailed scanning. These ships serve as the backbone of Remnant bulk salvage efforts, as well as their fast-logistics distribution network.

name: Peregrine (Peregrine (II))
description: The Peregrine is the first capital warship designed by Taely using fresh insights garnered from recent experimentation as well as renewed studies of the void sprites. Encompassing over a century of development since the last generation of warships was built, it is the forerunner of a new breed of Remnant ships. 	The Peregrine was designed along the lines of old-earth's fast-attack cruisers. Drawing on inspiration from its namesake, famed for being the fastest self-propelled lifeform on Earth, it is designed to strike hard and fast. It closes quickly with enemies to unleash devastating barrages in the opening seconds of combat. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Peregrine's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Smew (Smew (Miner))
description: The Remnant have long favored turns of action that avoid putting crew directly at risk; though their Terns are a rather effective result of this ideology, the Remnant still had to face the fact that, eventually, one of their manned ships was going to end up too crippled to escape to safety. To that end, the Smew was developed; though quite lightly armed, Smews are capable of carrying a considerable quantity of cargo and passengers for a ship of their size, and are durable enough to absorb some fire from enemies while doing so. 	Though originally designed as lifeboats, the surprisingly mobile freighter-fighter hybrid has seen a remarkable amount of usage in mining fleets, as a way to supplement the otherwise poor cargo capacity of the Ibis. Because their purpose can vary from fleet to fleet, Smews are traditionally sold with a fair amount of free space: enough for a small weapon, upgraded engines, or additional support systems. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

name: Starling (Starling (Heavy))
description: One of the strangest and most useful things that the Remnant have discovered in the abandoned worlds of the Ember Waste is alien cloaking technology. They have designed their scout ships to cloak when needed in order to explore alien territory without being seen... or to escape in a hurry after stealing something particularly valuable from those aliens. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Starling's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Starling (Starling (Sniper))
description: One of the strangest and most useful things that the Remnant have discovered in the abandoned worlds of the Ember Waste is alien cloaking technology. They have designed their scout ships to cloak when needed in order to explore alien territory without being seen... or to escape in a hurry after stealing something particularly valuable from those aliens. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Starling's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Grasshopper (Grasshopper (Hai Start))
description: Designed by the Hai to serve as a fast reconnaissance craft, the Grasshopper has been adopted by thrill-seekers and miners alike. At the same time, it is often used by Hai captains who are looking for effective protection at a low cost.

name: Aaulqra (Aaulqra (Brawler))
description: The Aaulqra is the oldest warship design currently produced by the High Houses in Successor space, with a recognizable lineage continuing back several thousand years to early in the old empire. It is compact, fast, and durable for a ship of its class, but has relatively limited internal space and lacks any significant cargo or passenger facilities. The captains of these vessels are often up-and-coming Successor officers hoping to prove themselves to one of the High Houses by demonstrating their mastery of the vessel; while most, of course, do not, the ship's flexibility and ubiquitous presence make it an excellent starting point for those who do.

name: Aaulqra (Aaulqra (Sniper))
description: The Aaulqra is the oldest warship design currently produced by the High Houses in Successor space, with a recognizable lineage continuing back several thousand years to early in the old empire. It is compact, fast, and durable for a ship of its class, but has relatively limited internal space and lacks any significant cargo or passenger facilities. The captains of these vessels are often up-and-coming Successor officers hoping to prove themselves to one of the High Houses by demonstrating their mastery of the vessel; while most, of course, do not, the ship's flexibility and ubiquitous presence make it an excellent starting point for those who do.

name: Kaskhorade (Kaskhorade (Brawler))
description: Serving as the heavy multipurpose backbone of the fleets of the various High Houses, the Kaskhorade trades some of the maneuverability of its smaller siblings for greater flexibility; in addition to being a capable warship, it also offers a sizable amount of free cargo and bunk space that allow it to fulfill a wide variety of missions. Along with serving as convoy escorts and fleet warships, these vessels are often used to transport high-ranking members of the High Houses, as they can remain well-defended while outfitted for fast and luxurious travel.

name: Kaskhorade (Kaskhorade (Sniper))
description: Serving as the heavy multipurpose backbone of the fleets of the various High Houses, the Kaskhorade trades some of the maneuverability of its smaller siblings for greater flexibility; in addition to being a capable warship, it also offers a sizable amount of free cargo and bunk space that allow it to fulfill a wide variety of missions. Along with serving as convoy escorts and fleet warships, these vessels are often used to transport high-ranking members of the High Houses, as they can remain well-defended while outfitted for fast and luxurious travel.

name: Kvelqde (Kvelqde (Mining))
description: This tiny shuttle is the smallest vessel operating in Successor space, and the first ship that new Successor pilots are able to get their arms on. Despite their small size, they are capable multipurpose vessels, and are frequently used for transporting passengers and cargo, and for short-duration research expeditions. 	The design of the Kvelqde is, like most Successor vessels, based on originals from the time of the Predecessors. While the modern incarnation is nowhere near as advanced, successive iterations with more limited resources have promoted the cost-efficiency and user-friendliness of the design.

name: Kvelqde (Kvelqde (Violent))
description: This tiny shuttle is the smallest vessel operating in Successor space, and the first ship that new Successor pilots are able to get their arms on. Despite their small size, they are capable multipurpose vessels, and are frequently used for transporting passengers and cargo, and for short-duration research expeditions. 	The design of the Kvelqde is, like most Successor vessels, based on originals from the time of the Predecessors. While the modern incarnation is nowhere near as advanced, successive iterations with more limited resources have promoted the cost-efficiency and user-friendliness of the design.

name: Kvelqde-Khora (Kvelqde-Khora (Mining))
description: One of the more industrious members of the People's Houses has done their best to ruggedize this Kvelqde: additional armor plating has been laid over most of the exposed hull, a second gun port has been attached to the underside, and the shield grid has had its capacity substantially increased. While not quite capable of standing toe-to-toe with a production interceptor of the High Houses, it bares enough teeth for a bit of light piracy, and its greater durability is quite welcome for navigating the decaying stations and hostile worlds of southwestern Successor space.

name: Myaede (Myaede (Mining))
description: The Myaede is neither elegant nor fast, but it has remained the mainstay of Successor commerce since before the collapse of the old empire over a thousand years ago, boasting a spacious cargo hold, heavy armor, and a flexible enough weapons layout to let it fight back in a pinch. Much like the grand heirlooms of the High Houses, a familial Myaede is often passed down through the lineage of spacefaring low-born Successors, and many of the pilots flying these first took the helm as children under a grandparent's watchful gaze.

name: Myaede (Myaede (Mining, Defensive))
description: The Myaede is neither elegant nor fast, but it has remained the mainstay of Successor commerce since before the collapse of the old empire over a thousand years ago, boasting a spacious cargo hold, heavy armor, and a flexible enough weapons layout to let it fight back in a pinch. Much like the grand heirlooms of the High Houses, a familial Myaede is often passed down through the lineage of spacefaring low-born Successors, and many of the pilots flying these first took the helm as children under a grandparent's watchful gaze.

name: Myaede (Myaede (Violent))
description: The Myaede is neither elegant nor fast, but it has remained the mainstay of Successor commerce since before the collapse of the old empire over a thousand years ago, boasting a spacious cargo hold, heavy armor, and a flexible enough weapons layout to let it fight back in a pinch. Much like the grand heirlooms of the High Houses, a familial Myaede is often passed down through the lineage of spacefaring low-born Successors, and many of the pilots flying these first took the helm as children under a grandparent's watchful gaze.

name: Nnaatej (Nnaatej (Defensive))
description: Owing to their amphibious nature, a substantial portion of the Successor population lives underwater. Most of their ships are built with this in mind and are capable of some degree of underwater operation. However, the Nnaatej is a specialist vessel built specifically for this purpose, shuttling passengers from deep ocean to deep space and back again. It is designed with a denser, pressure-stable hull, built-in maintenance systems, and increased resistance to corrosion and slowing effects. These features come at the cost of making it a heavy and expensive ship for its size, but are considered well worth it to ensure the safety and comfort of its passengers and cargo.

name: Ojde (Ojde (Mining))
description: Although it is the largest freighter employed by the Successors, the "Ojde" is still substantially smaller than large human freighters like the Bulk Freighter and Behemoth. While this limits the cargo capacity of any single ship, it also allows these vessels to be surprisingly fast and maneuverable and increases the number of facilities which can effectively tend to them. 	Though somewhat less popular among more traditional merchants than the time-tested Myaede, the increased cargo capacity of the Ojde makes it a more or less mandatory choice for those hoping to assemble a large-scale transport operation.

name: Stolsaqra (Stolsaqra (Military))
description: The Successors have limited experience in making warships this small, and while their attempt at an interceptor is durable and sports a surprising amount of firepower for a ship of its size, it is also plagued with power and propulsion issues, as most of their standard technology is either too large or not powerful enough to yield effective combat performance at this scale. The result is a ship that ambitious pilots call a challenge and prudent captains call a deathtrap, but that continues to see use as a patrol and escort vessel because of its speed and heavy armament. 	The Stolsaqra also has the distinction of being the only purpose-built warship manufactured by the High Houses that is made available to the general public, albeit with significantly downgraded systems compared to the military-exclusive model.

name: Stolsaqra (Stolsaqra (Mission Escort))
description: The Successors have limited experience in making warships this small, and while their attempt at an interceptor is durable and sports a surprising amount of firepower for a ship of its size, it is also plagued with power and propulsion issues, as most of their standard technology is either too large or not powerful enough to yield effective combat performance at this scale. description: The Successors have limited experience in making warships this small, and while their attempt at an interceptor is durable and sports a surprising amount of firepower for a ship of its size, it is also plagued with power and propulsion issues, as most of their standard technology is either too large or not powerful enough to yield effective combat performance at this scale. name: Veusade (Veusade (Surveillance))
description: Blessed with the honor of being named with the Successor word for swiftness, the Veusade is designed for only one purpose: to carry eight drag cannons as close to an enemy ship's hull as possible. 	Vessels of this lineage earned renown in many of the conflicts between the Predecessors' High Houses, catching and killing ships many times their size and escaping before reinforcements could arrive. In the present, such a narrowly-focused design makes these vessels ill-suited for multipurpose use, but they are frequently seen as auxiliary or police craft, owing to their ability to rapidly intercept and immobilize fleeing ships.

name: Vujlet (Vujlet (Aggressive))
description: Navigating the stars with the grace of a flitting bird, the compact Vujlet is a mass-produced High Houses warship flexible enough to serve in a variety of light-duty roles. Large enough to operate as a self-sufficient unit, these vessels serve as a useful bridge between short-ranged and relatively vulnerable interceptors, and larger, more resource-intensive warships that can be much more expensive to build and operate. 	The design was originally employed by House Kaatrij as a stealth reconnaissance vessel that made use of their then-recently-developed cloaking technology. As the alliance between the New Houses strengthened, the plans for the Vujlet were distributed among them, and the light warship rapidly became a mainstay of their fleets. Unfortunately, without the materials present in their Predecessors' domain, House Kaatrij has been unable to manufacture stealth equipment for the Vujlet in the modern era.

name: Vujlet (Vujlet (Surveillance))
description: Navigating the stars with the grace of a flitting bird, the compact Vujlet is a mass-produced High Houses warship flexible enough to serve in a variety of light-duty roles. Large enough to operate as a self-sufficient unit, these vessels serve as a useful bridge between short-ranged and relatively vulnerable interceptors, and larger, more resource-intensive warships that can be much more expensive to build and operate. Unfortunately, without the materials present in their Predecessors' domain, House Kaatrij has been unable to manufacture stealth equipment for the Vujlet in the modern era.

name: Vyrmeid (Vyrmeid (B))
description: These are tiny space creatures that feed on solar energy, storing it into two receptors found at the front of their bodies. They are extremely docile, and are found in large groups, almost never seen alone.

name: Vyrmeid (Vyrmeid (C))
description: These are tiny space creatures that feed on solar energy, storing it into two receptors found at the front of their bodies. They are extremely docile, and are found in large groups, almost never seen alone.

name: Autumn Leaf (Autumn Leaf (Heavy))
description: The Autumn Leaf is based on the Wanderer Summer Leaf light warship, but slightly larger and better equipped for combat. Unlike Wanderer peacetime ships, it is equipped with a turret mount in addition to the ports for fixed guns.

name: Heavy Gust (Heavy Gust (Moonbeam))
description: The Heavy Gust is a further modification of the Strong Wind, adjusted even more heavily for combat purposes at the expense of much of its precursor's peacetime utility. With these modifications, the Heavy Gust becomes both faster and deadlier, pushing the original civilian frame to its limits.

name: Tempest (Tempest (Heavy))
description: In response to the Unfettered invasion, the Wanderers have begun digging up ancient warship designs from their archives and putting them back into production. The Tempest is the first purpose-built warship they have manufactured in tens of thousands of years.

name: Tempest (Tempest (Missile))
description: In response to the Unfettered invasion, the Wanderers have begun digging up ancient warship designs from their archives and putting them back into production. The Tempest is the first purpose-built warship they have manufactured in tens of thousands of years.

name: Tempest (Tempest (Moonbeam))
description: In response to the Unfettered invasion, the Wanderers have begun digging up ancient warship designs from their archives and putting them back into production. The Tempest is the first purpose-built warship they have manufactured in tens of thousands of years.

name: Derecho (Derecho (Turret))
description: Like a latent gene waiting to express itself, the knowledge of how to wage war in space has been passed down through hundreds of generations of Wanderers. Based on one of their ancient designs, the Derecho has a mixture of agility and raw firepower that is well-suited to their present, rapidly changing situation.

name: Derecho (Derecho (Tough))
description: Like a latent gene waiting to express itself, the knowledge of how to wage war in space has been passed down through hundreds of generations of Wanderers. Based on one of their ancient designs, the Derecho has a mixture of agility and raw firepower that is well-suited to their present, rapidly changing situation.

name: Derecho (Derecho (Moonbeam))
description: Like a latent gene waiting to express itself, the knowledge of how to wage war in space has been passed down through hundreds of generations of Wanderers. Based on one of their ancient designs, the Derecho has a mixture of agility and raw firepower that is well-suited to their present, rapidly changing situation.

name: Hurricane (Hurricane (Turret))
description: The Hurricane is not built for speed, elegance, or versatility, but for one simple purpose: to be durable enough to serve as a rearguard, absorbing an enemy's attacks for long enough to allow the fleet it is guarding to escape.

name: Hurricane (Hurricane (Tough))
description: The Hurricane is not built for speed, elegance, or versatility, but for one simple purpose: to be durable enough to serve as a rearguard, absorbing an enemy's attacks for long enough to allow the fleet it is guarding to escape.

name: Hurricane (Hurricane (Moonbeam))
description: The Hurricane is not built for speed, elegance, or versatility, but for one simple purpose: to be durable enough to serve as a rearguard, absorbing an enemy's attacks for long enough to allow the fleet it is guarding to escape.

name: Winter Gale (Winter Gale (Heavy))
description: The Winter Gale was designed by the Wanderers as a hardier and better-armed alternative to their existing light patrol ships. The Gale's large number of weapon hardpoints makes it flexible enough to reconfigure for facing a wide variety of enemies.

name: Winter Gale (Winter Gale (Missile))
description: The Winter Gale was designed by the Wanderers as a hardier and better-armed alternative to their existing light patrol ships. The Gale's large number of weapon hardpoints makes it flexible enough to reconfigure for facing a wide variety of enemies.

name: Deep River (Deep River 0)
description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

name: Deep River (Deep River 1)
description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

name: Deep River (Deep River 2)
description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

name: Deep River (Deep River 3)
description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

name: Deep River (Deep River 4)
description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

name: Deep River (Deep River (Jump, Unarmed))
description: The Deep River is a modular freighter, designed to carry cargo in detachable pods.

name: Carrier (Carrier (Alpha))
description: The Carrier is more than just a warship: it is practically a mobile space station, with docking bays for an entire squadron of drones and fighters and enough crew to fill a small village. Although designed primarily for engaging enemies from a distance, a Carrier can also do significant damage in close combat.
